items.name: Asturias Bay
items.description: Known for its rugged cliffs, picturesque beaches, and rich maritime history. The bay features fishing ports, scenic coastal towns, and is influenced by the region’s mild oceanic climate.

items.name: Llanes Beach
items.description: Asturias is known for its charming rural villages, featuring traditional stone houses, lush green landscapes, and a rich cultural heritage.

items.name: Covadonga Sanctuary
items.description: A historic sanctuary nestled in the mountains, famous for its religious significance.

items.name: Picos de Europa Park
items.description: A breathtaking national park with hiking trails and scenic views.

items.name: Gijón Aquarium
items.address: Best place to be in contact with nature
items.description: An interactive aquarium featuring marine life from the Cantabrian Sea.

items.name: Oviedo Cathedral
items.description: A gothic cathedral with impressive architecture and historical significance.

items.name: Asturian People
items.address: People of Asturias are known for their rich cultural heritage, traditional music, and folklore.
items.description: The Asturian people are known for their warm hospitality, strong sense of community, and vibrant traditions.

items.name: Teatro Campoamor
items.description: A grand theater known for hosting opera and cultural events.
